result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon P. Maejeck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED -balance to be paid w/in the first 2yrs or DOC to return Deft to court.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay fine of $4,800.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges for a total of $7,099.00.  Bond to apply.  Balance to be paid within first 2yrs or DOC to return Deft to court.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days (PD -Val Karls).
Not to unlawfully operate a motor vehicle.

supervisions.notes: Ignition interlock is to end the same time as the revocation.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Val Karls.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 4-1/2yrs WSP; initial confinement of 18mos followed by 3yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Credit for 53 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights.  PD's office to submit reimbursement figures for atty fees w/in 45 days.  DL revoked for three years.  Ignition interlock ordered for three years.
